name: Mississippi
hint: Largest river system in North America, flowing south to the Gulf of Mexico

name: Missouri
hint: Longest river in North America, major tributary of the Mississippi

name: Colorado
hint: River that carved the Grand Canyon, flows through the American Southwest

name: Rio Grande
hint: River forming much of the US-Mexico border

name: Columbia
hint: Largest river in the Pacific Northwest, major source of hydroelectric power

name: Yukon
hint: Major river flowing through Canada and Alaska to the Bering Sea

name: Ohio
hint: Major tributary of the Mississippi, historically key to westward expansion

name: St. Lawrence
hint: River connecting the Great Lakes to the Atlantic Ocean through Quebec

name: Mackenzie
hint: Longest river system in Canada, flowing north to the Arctic Ocean

name: Arkansas
hint: Major tributary of the Mississippi, flows through Kansas, Oklahoma, and Arkansas

name: Snake River
hint: Major tributary of the Columbia, carving Hells Canyon, the deepest gorge in North America

name: Tennessee River
hint: Major Ohio River tributary, key to the TVA dam system in the southeastern US

name: Platte River
hint: Wide shallow river in Nebraska, historic route of the Oregon Trail migration

name: Fraser River
hint: Longest river in British Columbia, famous for its massive Pacific salmon runs

name: Red River
hint: River forming the Texas-Oklahoma border, tributary of the Mississippi

name: Nelson River
hint: Manitoba river draining Lake Winnipeg to Hudson Bay, major hydroelectric source

name: Churchill River
hint: Important river in Manitoba and Saskatchewan flowing to Hudson Bay

name: Sacramento River
hint: Longest river in California, flowing through the Central Valley to San Francisco Bay

name: Usumacinta River
hint: Largest river in Central America, forming the Guatemala-Mexico border through ancient Mayan lands

name: Potomac River
hint: River flowing through Washington DC, George Washington's home Mount Vernon sits on its banks
